channel.title: Incredibly minor gripe thread
channel.description:
There have been lots of threads with people complaining about Black Mesa's big problems (balance issues, bugs, etc.), but I haven't seen much in the way of small complaints.
So I ask, what are the little things in BM that bugged you? It can be as small and insignificant as you like.
Personally, I don't like how Gordon lowers his gun while sprinting (with always run off). In most games, the player character lowers his gun so the player will know that shooting while sprinting is not an option. But in BM, you [i]can[/i] shoot while sprinting, so it's totally pointless. It looks really silly when you're sprinting and you have your gun lowered, but then you fire it and it just pops right up for a moment. I kind of hope there's a way to disable this, because it sort of bugs me.

item.title: Incredibly minor gripe thread
item.dc:creator: cacao
item.description:
I hate where the put the loading screen after the dragging scene. It should be right after the second black out.

Read full topic

item.title: Incredibly minor gripe thread
item.dc:creator: Dark_Signal
item.description:
I personally hate how the marines went from using citizen base animations to combine soldier animations. Sure they needed quick grenade throwing and melee butting, but the citizen animations seemed more human in the early screenshots that way.
Not like the developers wanted to portray them that way, The voice acting for the HECU is enough injustice.

Read full topic

item.title: Incredibly minor gripe thread
item.dc:creator: BendyBread
item.description:
Don’t know if this is a minor gripe or not, but oh well.

  1. Ichthyosaurs are underwhelmingly weak HP wise. If they’re going to be that squishy, they need to swim faster to make them a real threat. I personally increased their HP so they require 4 total crossbow hits, up from 2 (I increased max ammo on crossbow from 10 to 15 to ensure I don’t just destroy my supplies so quickly).

  2. The music/sounds feel random. Maybe that’s how it was in half life (i cant remember the music to be honest even though i played it like 3 weeks ago), but it’s odd. I love the tracks like in the outdoor scene of WGH, fight in QE, and the dam scene of ST. Otherwise it’s very silent, not even slight abient music playing.
    I don’t want a soundtrack or anything playing at random, but it feels like you get 30 seconds - 2 minutes of music, then it’s quite for another 30 minutes.

Read full topic

item.title: Incredibly minor gripe thread
item.dc:creator: Bjossi
item.description:
xalener:

What’s with the sound attenuation? Explosions that are inches away sound like they’re miles away and half as loud as they should be :s

That is because the explosion sounds in BM are garbage at best (This is not with the tinnitus effect, I mean the sounds as they sound without it, when Gordon is far enough away.). How the BM team allowed it to pass through relative to the mostly great gun firing sounds is beyond my scope of comprehension, it sticks out like a sore thumb. Our best hope of rectifying this is to replace it ourselves I think.

Read full topic

item.title: Incredibly minor gripe thread
item.dc:creator: warpedfreeman
item.description:
Callinstead:

I don’t consider this to be a minor gripe, it drives me mad. The night sky in bm_c2a2c is very unrealistic and inconsistent, especially with the size/brightness of the moon. Since the stars are rendered via particle effect the stars sometime disappear and then suddenly reappear in different spots. I look up and… there are stars INFRONT of the moon!

Once I was getting stars infront of mesas in the distance… O_o I can’t tell you how much this sky drives me crazy!!

aye… from inside the control room the moon does not bright that much

Read full topic

item.title: Incredibly minor gripe thread
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
Nah, not the tinnitus, I mean the fact that explosions are just really quiet.

Read full topic

item.title: Incredibly minor gripe thread
item.dc:creator: Lumbergh
item.description:
xalener:

What’s with the sound attenuation? Explosions that are inches away sound like they’re miles away and half as loud as they should be :s

Are you thinking of the deafening percussive effect of a nearby explosion? I believe the idea is that it temporarily deafens you, thus you don’t hear much of anything for a few moments.

Read full topic

item.title: Incredibly minor gripe thread
item.dc:creator: sgtpieman
item.description:
Dotard:

Feel free and create the models yourself :retard:

Don’t worry, I’m actually working on stuff myself.

My only gripe with that it that it’s not the base mod, it’s my modifications. I can mod Black Mesa all I want, but when I do it ceases to be the original mod, and becomes a mod of a mod (if that makes sense).

Aw well, this is the incredibly minor gripe thread, so fair game. What’s funny is that I personally don’t care about that detail myself, but it is something I would have done before modeling a Harrier in the first place if I was on the team… But I’m not.

Read full topic

item.title: Incredibly minor gripe thread
item.dc:creator: Joe_Freeman
item.description:
Flatline:

I think you’ve answered your own problem there. Black Mesa is entirely repurposed from an existing facility, some of which clearly date back to the 50s/60s.

Yeah, but in the original game it didn’t feel as old. Apart from Blast Pit and Apprehension, I don’t remember really any other “dilapidated” areas.

Read full topic

item.title: Incredibly minor gripe thread
item.dc:creator: ojcoolj
item.description:
Gunsofglory:

In BP and PU, I noticed a lot more use of HL2 textures, and that Aperture roof texture (The grey tiles one) look weird in some places and was very repetitive . That’s about all I can remember.

Repetitive? O.o

Did you expect every single floor/wall/ceiling to have its own individual appearance?

Read full topic

item.title: Incredibly minor gripe thread

item.description:
BendyBread:

…In Surface Tension and Forget about Freeman, they don’t really have enough HECU vs Alien combat sequences. It’s like they just chopped them all out and didn’t try to re-implement them anywhere else. It kind of ruins the whole “Humans are losing control of everything” immersion aspect to me.

https://forums.blackmesasource.com/showthread.php?t=15065

Read full topic

item.title: Incredibly minor gripe thread
item.dc:creator: Flatline
item.description:
Joe Freeman:

It really pisses me off that the some parts of Office Complex look really old. They just don’t feel the same.

Actually, I think most of the facility in BM is a lot older than in the original. The only places that look “modern” are anomalous materials, questionable ethics and lambda core. Not including Inbound.

I think you’ve answered your own problem there. Black Mesa is entirely repurposed from an existing facility, some of which clearly date back to the 50s/60s.

Read full topic

item.title: Incredibly minor gripe thread
item.dc:creator: BendyBread
item.description:
I understand the whole “variation of air crafts” thing, but honestly that scene was kind of hectic. Trying to fight like 7 HECU people, then blow up the tank. I did watch the alien and military aircrafts for a bit, but it didn’t really click that they weren’t different until I came to this thread (not saying it’s an bad opinion, I just personally didn’t notice).

On to my own minor gripe (I guess they’re minor).

  1. Bullsquids are basically walking turrets. They don’t charge like a bull anymore.
  2. In Surface Tension and Forget about Freeman, they don’t really have enough HECU vs Alien combat sequences. It’s like they just chopped them all out and didn’t try to re-implement them anywhere else. It kind of ruins the whole “Humans are losing control of everything” immersion aspect to me.

Read full topic

item.title: Incredibly minor gripe thread
item.dc:creator: Dotard
item.description:
sgtpieman:

Dotard, I hate that argument so so so so much. Just because something is a game doesn’t mean you can cut corners or remove common sense. Hell, even the Black Mesa devs know that! That’s why so many places from Half-Life were redesigned to make more sense. They didn’t just say “Oh, it’s a game, we don’t have to make this seem plausible or anything.” I commend the devs for actually putting some thought in the mod rather than leaving everything weird because it’s a game and doesn’t really matter. I think some things could have been improved, and having F-16s or something instead of Harriers would have been a better choice design-wise, but at least the devs tried to make this seem plausible.

Feel free and create the models yourself :retard:

Read full topic

item.title: Incredibly minor gripe thread
item.dc:creator: dky.tehkingd.u
item.description:
Would it actually be worth the man-hours required to create new models and textures for a single scene that most players don’t bother to look at, much less scrutinize the details of?

The low utility of something like this does not justify the work required to make it.

Read full topic

item.title: Incredibly minor gripe thread
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
https://forums.blackmesasource.com/showthread.php?t=15472

It doesn’t matter, it’s an inconsequential detail. The average player doesn’t even know/care what model of jet fighter is that supposed to be or that not all jet fighters are supersonic. Besides, what counts is the message that scene conveys, not the technical details.

Read full topic
